hero.headline: ERP built for metal fabrication.
hero.subheadline: Production, costing, and planning designed for job-based manufacturing.
hero.intro: This system is designed specifically for metal fabricators. It supports real production workflows, not accounting-driven workarounds. The focus is on job shops, make-to-order production, and compliance.

problem.title: Why generic ERP systems fail metal fabricators
problem.intro: Most ERP systems are designed around accounting, not production. As a result, metal fabricators often rely on spreadsheets and manual processes to manage jobs and shop-floor execution.
items: Lack of cutting optimization for sheet metal
Production planning managed outside the ERP
Variable product tax rates not handled automatically
problem.conclusion: These problems increase compliance risk, reduce efficiency, and degrade quality of service.

whoFor.title: Who this system is designed for
whoFor.intro: This ERP is designed for metal fabrication companies with:
criteria: A need for accurate job costing and material tracking
Metal stock and sheet inventory management requirements
Cutting optimization needs for laser, plasma, or waterjet
GDPR and EU data protection compliance needs
users: Fabricators producing custom or small-batch parts
whoFor.notFor: This system is not designed for:

manufacturing.title: Manufacturing-first design
manufacturing.intro: The system is built around real manufacturing concepts used in metal fabrication, and it continuously adapts to complex and evolving European compliance requirements.

features.desc: Track every job from quote to delivery with complete workflow visibility and operation-level detail

features.name: Production Planning
features.desc: Manage production capacity and schedule operations efficiently across your shop floor

features.name: Material Planning

workflow.title: From quote to dispatch
workflow.intro: The system connects key production steps in a single workflow:

steps.name: Quotation & Estimation
steps.desc: Calculate costs accurately with material, labor, machine time, and cutting optimization

steps.name: Production Planning
steps.desc: Schedule operations across work centers with inventory availability checks and cutting optimization

steps.name: Shop-Floor Execution
steps.desc: Touch-panel interface for job tracking, time recording, and quality control

steps.name: Invoicing & Compliance
steps.desc: Generate Peppol-compliant e-invoices and waybills with correct VAT rates

steps.name: Dispatch & Delivery
steps.desc: Pack, write off bundled items, and dispatch jobs to customers

steps.name: Analytics
steps.desc: Track actual vs. estimated costs with complete transparency and scrap accounting

workflow.conclusion: The goal is consistency and traceability across the entire job lifecycle.

caseStudy.title: Used in real production environments
caseStudy.challengeText: Skarda Nams struggled with accurate quoting using various metal types, live inventory updates, metal write-off capabilities, production planning, compliant invoicing, inaccurate costing and paper-based tracking.
caseStudy.solutionText: Implemented Kenzap Factory with integrated quotation, production routing, and shop-floor execution modules. Machine operators adopted the touch-panel interface within two weeks of deployment. Peppol e-invoicing was configured to meet EU compliance requirements. Integration with Moneo accounting software for simplified tax reporting.
resultItems: Reduction in quoting time through automated material calculation
Complete visibility into shop-floor operations and manufacturing stages
Peppol e-invoicing compliance achieved, with integration to BMD accounting software
Material waste reduction through cutting optimization
Faster production planning with real-time inventory checks
GDPR compliance and EU data residency maintained throughout operations
caseStudy.quote: We have a system that works the way our shop floor works. The operators adapted to the interface immediately, and our job costing is now reliable. Tax rates are handled automatically based on product type, which saves us time and headaches during invoicing.

implementation.title: Implementation approach
implementation.intro: Implementation follow a standard structure designed to minimize disruption.
principles: Hardware setup and software installation on factory systems
Product catalog and metal inventory database configuration
User role assignment and responsibility definition
Comprehensive training for operators and management teams
System integration and financial reporting synchronization
implementation.outro: Implementation can be delivered by consultants with manufacturing and ERP backgrounds or by Kenzap engineer directly.

deployment.title: Deployment options
deployment.intro: The system supports multiple deployment models to match operational, regulatory, and data sovereignty needs.

options.name: Vendor-managed cloud
options.desc: Fully managed hosting in European data centers with automatic updates, backups, and security patches. Ideal for companies focused on operations.

options.name: Customer-managed cloud
options.desc: Deploy on your own cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP) with full control over configuration and access. Suitable for IT-capable organizations.

options.name: Self-hosted deployment
options.desc: On-premises installation for maximum data sovereignty and control. Required for some regulated industries or highly sensitive operations.

deployment.outro: All deployment options use the same software, follow the same upgrade path, and maintain feature parity. Data remains in European jurisdictions for GDPR compliance.
